docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 26--The Latin American Free Trade Association will open a conference in Mexico City tomorrow to consider Cuba's application for membership.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 26--The Latin American Free Trade Association will open a conference in Mexico City tomorrow to consider Cuba's application for membership.

headline.main: LATIN TRADE GROUP WEIGHS CUBAN PLEA

docs.snippet: British pound sterling and the Canadian dollar declined in the foreign exchange last week.  The pound sterling was weak due to speculation about a lower bank rate. The pound ranged between $2.8049 and $2.8022. It closed at $2.8025, off 13 points.
docs.lead_paragraph: British pound sterling and the Canadian dollar declined in the foreign exchange last week. The pound sterling was weak due to speculation about a lower bank rate. The pound ranged between $2.8049 and $2.8022. It closed at $2.8025, off 13 points.

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 27--The second conference of the Latin American Free Commerce Association was inaugurated formally here this morning with words of encouragement but with a growing fear that the meeting could be blown apart over the question of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 27--The second conference of the Latin American Free Commerce Association was inaugurated formally here this morning with words of encouragement but with a growing fear that the meeting could be blown apart over the question of Cuba's demand for admission.

headline.main: LATINS FACE FIGHT AT TRADE MEETING; Parley of Free Commerce Group May Hit Snag on Cuban Membership 3 NATIONS BACK HAVANA But 5 Other Countries Cite Political and Economic Reasons for Exclusion LATINS FACE FIGHT AT TRADE MEETING

byline.original: By PAUL P. KENNEDY Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 28-- Attempts to arrive at a formula for dealing with Cuba's demand for admission to the Latin American Free Trade Association failed today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 28-- Attempts to arrive at a formula for dealing with Cuba's demand for admission to the Latin American Free Trade Association failed today.

headline.main: CUBA ISSUE PERILS LATIN TRADE BLOC; Parley Fails to End Dispute on Admission Question

byline.original: By PAUL P. KENNEDY Special to The New York Times

headline.main: Latin Trade Groups' Talks Delayed by Cuban Dispute

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 29-- Adolfo Lanus, a journalist who has held high political posts in the past, became Argentina's Defense Minister today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 29-- Adolfo Lanus, a journalist who has held high political posts in the past, became Argentina's Defense Minister today.

headline.main: Argentina Fills Defense Post; Journalist Is Named Minister

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times

headline.main: SHIPPING MAILS; ALL HOURS GIVEN IN DAYLIGHT SAVING TIME
